sen.j: 近津尾神社（ちかつおじんじゃ）は、滋賀県大津市国分に鎮座する神社である。
sen.e: Chikatsuo-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kokubu, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Chikatsuo-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kokubu, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Chikatsuo-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kokubu, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 『石山寺記録中之巻三』によると、承安 (日本)3年に石山寺座主公祐僧都が石山寺の鎮守社として創建したという。
sen.e: According to "Ishiyama-dera Temple Record" vol. 2, chapter 3, Ishiyama-dera Temple's head priest Kinsachi Sozu founded this shrine as the Chinju-sha shrine (Shinto shrine on Buddhist temple grounds dedicated to the tutelary deity of the area) of Ishiyama-dera Temple in 1173.
sen.cmt: ウェブでは『石山寺記録』中之巻3でしたので訂正しました。
sen.e: According to "Ishiyama-dera Temple Record" vol. 2, chapter 3, Ishiyama-dera Temple's head priest Kinsachi Sozu founded this shrine as the Chinju-sha shrine (Shinto shrine on Buddhist temple grounds dedicated to the tutelary deity of the area) of Ishiyama-dera Temple in 1173.

According to "Ishiyama-dera Temple Record" vol. 2, chapter 3, Ishiyama-dera Temple's head priest Kinsachi Sozu founded this shrine as the Chinju-sha shrine (Shinto shrine on Buddhist temple grounds dedicated to the tutelary deity of the area) of Ishiyama-dera Temple in 1173.

sen.j: 元禄年間には松尾芭蕉が境内地に移り住み幻住庵を営んだ。
sen.e: Basho MATSUO settled in the precincts in the Genroku era (period from 1688 to 1703), establishing the Genju-an hermitage to live in.
Basho MATSUO settled in the precincts in the Genroku era (period from 1688 to 1703), establishing the Genju-an hermitage to live in.
Basho MATSUO settled in the precincts in the Genroku era (period from 1688 to 1703), establishing the Genju-an hermitage to live in.

sen.j: なお、幻住庵は昭和15年に再建されている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the Genju-an hermitage was rebuilt in 1940.
Meanwhile, the Genju-an hermitage was rebuilt in 1940.
Meanwhile, the Genju-an hermitage was rebuilt in 1940.
